DataElement.preferredName: Person Non-Cigarette Tobacco Product Use Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking._The dried cured leaves of the tobacco plant, Nicotiana tabacum, used for smoking, chewing, or snuff.  Tobacco contains nicotine, a stimulant, and other biologically active ingredients having carcinogenic properties._The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced._Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose._Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent that a condition or situation has occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking._The dried cured leaves of the tobacco plant, Nicotiana tabacum, used for smoking, chewing, or snuff.  Tobacco contains nicotine, a stimulant, and other biologically active ingredients having carcinogenic properties._The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced._Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking.(NCI):The leaves of the tobacco plant, Nicotiana tabacum, dried and prepared for smoking or ingestion.:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking.

The dried cured leaves of the tobacco plant, Nicotiana tabacum, used for smoking, chewing, or snuff.  Tobacco contains nicotine, a stimulant, and other biologically active ingredients having carcinogenic properties.
The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent that a condition or situation has occurred.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: In your ENTIRE LIFE, have you
ReferenceDocuments.description: In your ENTIRE LIFE, have you ever smoked at least 50 cigars/pipe/?
